original: bden min de bzhin brdzun pa min //

original: rnal @51a * //

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa ni gcig tu dag pa ste /

analyzed: de khyad par du nye bar bstan pa'i phyir mdor byas pa /
translated: In order to teach that specifically, he says,

analyzed: pha dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs kyi khams su brjod do //

analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i longs spyod kyi rang bzhin spangs pa'o //

analyzed: nang la zhes bya ba yang gzugs med pa'i khams su ye shes tsam la'o //

analyzed: btsun mo kun la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi mchog dang lha mo'i 'khor la'o //

analyzed: chos la zhes bya ba ni de'i tshogs la'o //

translated: “In regard to all actions” means

translated: in regard to the ordinary actions, etc. of that.

analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin yang de rnams brjod par bya ste / bdag med pa la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The nature of those is to be stated.🔽“In regard to selflessness” means

analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: in regard to the selflessness of the person.

original: 'dir ni 'khor bar 'bras bu dang / byed rgyu tsam gyi bdag med par yang bsgom pa dang / dgra bcom pa la rnam par gnas pa'i gnas skabs gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'khor bar 'bras bu dang / byed rgyu tsam gyi bdag med par yang bsgom pa dang / dgra bcom pa la rnam par gnas pa'i gnas skabs gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the cultivation of the selflessness of the effect and the selflessness of the cause in saṃsāra, and the state of abiding in the state of the arhat are stated.

original: 'bras bu la zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams 'bras bur sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu la zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams 'bras bur sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “In regard to the effect” means in regard to the effect of the stream-enterer, etc., because they are established as effects.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa sgom pa la sogs pa byed pa las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa sgom pa la sogs pa byed pa las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “In regard to the cause” means in regard to the cause of the cultivation of selflessness, etc., because they arise from the action.

original: byed rgyu nyid 'ba' zhig ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu nyid 'ba' zhig ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Only the causal condition is not a cause.

original: bya ba'ang shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba'ang shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and also the action is to be known.

original: rgyu la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rgyu la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the cause, etc.,

original: bya ba zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i ming ngo //
analyzed: bya ba zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i ming ngo //
translated: the so-called action is the name of the action.

original: gnyis po de yang so sor bsgrub bya dang / sgrub pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir grub pa gsungs pa /🔽bsgrub bya sgrub thabs rdo rje la //
analyzed: gnyis po de yang so sor bsgrub bya dang / sgrub pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir grub pa gsungs pa / bsgrub bya sgrub thabs rdo rje la //
translated: And also those two are established, because they are the nature of the object to be accomplished and the means of accomplishment.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The object to be accomplished and the means of accomplishment are the vajra.

original: de yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba ni bdag med pa'i bsgom pa las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba ni bdag med pa'i bsgom pa las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is because the object to be accomplished, such as the fruit of stream-entry, is born from the meditation on selflessness.

original: sgrub pa'i thabs kyang bdag med par bsgom @51b pas shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i thabs kyang bdag med par bsgom @51b pas shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And the means of accomplishment is to be known by the meditation on selflessness.

original: bdag med par bsgom pa la sogs pa yang rgyu dang bsgrub par bya ba rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med par bsgom pa la sogs pa yang rgyu dang bsgrub par bya ba rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And the meditation on selflessness, etc., is to be known by the cause and the object to be accomplished, such as the fruit of stream-entry.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i byed pa po nyid kyi phyir sgrub pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i byed pa po nyid kyi phyir sgrub pa'i thabs so //
translated: And the means of accomplishment is because of the nature of the agent of the fruit of stream-entry, etc.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung gis kyang skye 'gro'i gnas pa gsungs /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung gis kyang skye 'gro'i gnas pa gsungs /
translated: The texts of the Yogācāra also teach the abiding of living beings.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rgyu la yang 'di ltar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rgyu la yang 'di ltar blta bar bya ste /
translated: Thus means that the result and the cause should be viewed in this way.

original: kun gzhi rnam shes zhes bya ba ni bdag dang sems can dang don nub cing bag chags spangs pa la'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam shes zhes bya ba ni bdag dang sems can dang don nub cing bag chags spangs pa la'o //
translated: The so-called store consciousness is the self, the sentient being, and the meaning that has sunk down, and is the abandonment of the imprints.

original: chos kyi dbyings la zhes pa ni chos rnams kyi bdag la sogs par 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba dang / rgyu nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la zhes pa ni chos rnams kyi bdag la sogs par 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba dang / rgyu nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la'o //
translated: The realm of phenomena is the arising of the grasping of the self and so on of phenomena and so on, and the afflicted mind is the cause.

original: ma byung zhes bya ba ni 'dir dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir so sor skye ba spangs pa'o //
analyzed: ma byung zhes bya ba ni 'dir dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir so sor skye ba spangs pa'o //
translated: Not arisen means that here, because of the indivisible nature, the individual arising is abandoned.

original: bdag med pa rnams kyi spyod pa rnam par shes pa rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam gyis 'khor bar dgra bcom pa'i gnas skabs gsungs pa /
analyzed: bdag med pa rnams kyi spyod pa rnam par shes pa rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam gyis 'khor bar dgra bcom pa'i gnas skabs gsungs pa /
translated: The conduct of the selfless is the state of the arhat, which is samsara by means of the mere cause and result of consciousness.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rnam par 'brel pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rnam par 'brel pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: The result and so on are the teaching of the connection of the result and the cause.

original: bya ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'bras bu dang bya ba du ba la sogs pa me la sogs pas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'bras bu dang bya ba du ba la sogs pa me la sogs pas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word action and so on means that the effect and action, such as smoke, do not exist due to fire and so on.

original: bsgrub bya dang gtan tshigs me dang du bas shes par bya ba'i phyir 'di gnyis ka'ang sgrub thabs so //
analyzed: bsgrub bya dang gtan tshigs me dang du bas shes par bya ba'i phyir 'di gnyis ka'ang sgrub thabs so //
translated: Because the probandum and the reason are to be known by fire and smoke, both of these are methods of proof.

original: de yang du ba la sogs pas sgrub pa'i thabs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang du ba la sogs pas sgrub pa'i thabs su shes par bya'o //
translated: And that should be understood as the method of proof by smoke and so on.

original: phyi rol la sogs pa'i sgrub thabs dang / byed pa por cha shas med par bdag nyid kyi blos ma log par mthong bas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang dag par rig pa'i dbye ba can lta bur brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: phyi rol la sogs pa'i sgrub thabs dang / byed pa por cha shas med par bdag nyid kyi blos ma log par mthong bas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang dag par rig pa'i dbye ba can lta bur brtag par bya ste /
translated: The method of proof of external and so on, and the self that is not negated by the mind as a partless agent, should be considered as having the distinction of the correct knowledge of the grasped and grasper.

original: 'di dag ni tshig tsam nyid do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni tshig tsam nyid do //
translated: These are mere words.

original: skye 'gro la sogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: skye 'gro la sogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The statement about birth and so on is

analyzed: sems can la zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig las gcig nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i dgongs pa ste /
translated: the intention of sentient beings is that the single foundation consciousness of the world of the vessel is one's own.

original: 'dis 'di'i don du mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'di'i don du mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: He is the one who is desirous of this.

original: de la nam mkha'i khams zhes bya ba ni sems dpa'i khams so //
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i khams zhes bya ba ni sems dpa'i khams so //
translated: Therein, the element of space is the element of the sentient being.

original: de las gzhan pa rnams kyi bdag //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams kyi bdag //
translated: The other ones are the self.

original: ces bya ba'i khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: This is the special teaching.

analyzed: bdag med pa dang bdag ces bya ba dang / zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i gzhung gis skye 'gro gang zhig de'i gnas su gsungs pa'o //
translated: The selflessness and the self are the living beings who are taught to be the abode of that.

original: dngos po med dang zhes bya ba ni @52a * //
analyzed: dngos po med dang zhes bya ba ni @52a * //
translated: The non-entity is

analyzed: dngos med min zhes bya ba yang kun rdzob kyi dngos po'i tshul gyi phyir ro //
translated: The non-non-entity is from the mode of the conventional entity.

original: nye bar thob pa'i gnas kyi khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: nye bar thob pa'i gnas kyi khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: The special abode of the attainment is taught:

original: bde pa can du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khor ba'i nang du bying ba'i gnas skabs bzhin du rnal 'byor rnam par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bde pa can du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khor ba'i nang du bying ba'i gnas skabs bzhin du rnal 'byor rnam par spyod pa'o //
translated: In Sukhāvatī, etc. , the yogi/nī practices in the state of being immersed in cyclic existence.

original: aa skyes zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: aa skyes zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The non-birth is

analyzed: aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la'o //

analyzed: skyon bral la zhes bya ba ni ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la'o //

analyzed: rdul bral zhes bya ba ni rdo rje la'o //

analyzed: sdig bcom zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i nga rgyal la'o //
translated: The sin-destroyer is on the vajra-pride.

analyzed: dpa' rlabs med pa'i rang bzhin la //
translated: The wave-free nature

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun du bzang po'i rnam pa la lha gnas par brjod pa'o //
translated: is the abode of the gods, the aspect of Samantabhadra.

translated: The divine incense is stated:

analyzed: gsang ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The secret and so forth.

translated: There, the secret is this Heruka mandala of the nature of the pure realm of phenomena, which is to be accomplished.🔽The supreme is the lord of the dance of the discrimination wisdom, the sun.

original: dgyes pa zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes nyid de rdo rje nyi ma la'o //
analyzed: dgyes pa zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes nyid de rdo rje nyi ma la'o //
translated: The joy is the equality wisdom itself, on the vajra-sun.

analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The phrase all of them indicates the perfection of diligence.

analyzed: sangs rgyas kun khyab ces bya ba ni rta mchog gi'o /
translated: The phrase pervading all buddhas indicates the supreme horse.

original: sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni bya ba nan tan la'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni bya ba nan tan la'o //
translated: The word hero indicates the perfection of action.

analyzed: lha'i bdag po zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i khyad par gyi bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase lord of gods indicates the action of a special person.

analyzed: lha'i bdag po zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i tshig las gsang ba zhes brjod pa rgyas par gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase lord of gods indicates the secret speech of a person, as stated in the extensive version.

original: lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni mdor bstan pa'i rim pa'i rjes su yang he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor la lha'i rim pa mchog rgyas par gsungs pa /
analyzed: lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni mdor bstan pa'i rim pa'i rjes su yang he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor la lha'i rim pa mchog rgyas par gsungs pa /
translated: The verse beginning with five and so on is a summary of the sequence of the supreme mandala of Heruka, which is stated in the extensive version.

original: dkar mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa 'phar ma gcig par lha mo la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhi po rnams ni shar gyi sgo la sogs pa srung ba'o //
analyzed: dkar mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa 'phar ma gcig par lha mo la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhi po rnams ni shar gyi sgo la sogs pa srung ba'o //
translated: The verse beginning with Gaurī and so on indicates the four goddesses such as Gaurī in the single-chambered square mandala as the guardians of the eastern gate and so on.

original: pukka l'i la sogs pa ni dbang ldan la sogs pa'i mtshams su yang dag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: pukka l'i la sogs pa ni dbang ldan la sogs pa'i mtshams su yang dag par gnas pa'o //
translated: Pukkasi and so forth are situated in the northeast and other directions.

original: dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the mandala of nine deities.

original: de ltar skam pa ma la sogs pa ni sgo srung ma'o //
analyzed: de ltar skam pa ma la sogs pa ni sgo srung ma'o //
translated: Thus, the goddesses beginning with Vāriyoginī are the gate-keepers.

original: me tog ma la sogs pa ni mtshams kyi cha la'o //
analyzed: me tog ma la sogs pa ni mtshams kyi cha la'o //
translated: The goddesses beginning with Puṣpā are in the intermediate directions.

original: de bzhin du nyi ma la sogs pa ni sgo la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyi ma la sogs pa ni sgo la'o //
translated: Similarly, the goddesses beginning with Sūryā are in the gates.

original: l'a sya dang phreng ba ma dang de bzhin du gang ma dang glu ma rnams ni @52b mtshams su'o //
analyzed: l'a sya dang phreng ba ma dang de bzhin du gang ma dang glu ma rnams ni @52b mtshams su'o //
translated: Lāsya, Mālā, and likewise, Gītā and Nṛtya are in the intermediate directions.

original: de bzhin du padma la sogs pa ni sgor gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du padma la sogs pa ni sgor gnas pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the goddesses beginning with Padmā are situated in the gates.

original: gling bu ma dang pi wang ma dang / rdza rnga ma dang / mu kunda rnams ni mtshams su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gling bu ma dang pi wang ma dang / rdza rnga ma dang / mu kunda rnams ni mtshams su shes pa'o //
translated: Veṇu, Vīṇā, Muraja, and Mṛdaṅga are known to be in the intermediate directions.

original: rdo rje sgo lcags ma la sogs pa ni sgor gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sgo lcags ma la sogs pa ni sgor gnas pa'o //
translated: Vajrāṅkuśī and so forth are situated in the gates.

original: spyan dang m'a ma k'i dang gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma rnams ni mtshams su'o //
analyzed: spyan dang m'a ma k'i dang gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma rnams ni mtshams su'o //
translated: Lochanā, Māmakī, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and Tārā are in the intermediate directions.

original: gang du bshad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang du bshad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Where it is said,

original: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor dkyil 'khor nyid //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor dkyil 'khor nyid //
translated: The mandala of the Buddhas is the very mandala.
